description:
This library allows automatic instance creation of presentation objects given associated business objects. The mapping is configured through custom attributes. The complex properties can automatically be retrieved or only retrieved when specified by the user  via Linq expressions. Reflection is used only for initialization. Delegates are dynamically created to allow fast processing.

More information at:
http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/986671/Creating-presentation-objects-with-PresentationMap
releaseNotes:
Version 2.0.1
- Fixed: MapInfo.Get() method is now public again (accidently put to internal)

Version 2.0.0
- Implemented : Mapping with Fluent API. Use MapContext.InitializeAPIMappings() to initialize the mappings.
- Signature change: Replaced MapContext.Initialize() by MapContext.InitializeAttributeMapping().
- Implemented: Generic classes are now supported.
- Implemented: Polymorphism is now supported.
- Implemented: Possibility to specify more than one pattern for MapContext.InitializeAttributeMapping() by using the | character.
- Implemented: No exception is thrown when a member in presentation class doesn't map with the business class. It will be ignored.
- Fixed: LinkTo attribute can now be used multiple times on a member.
- Fixed: Array of unmapped objects in presentation type now works properly.
summary: Map presentation types to business types to allow automatic instance creation.
title: Presentation / Business entity mapper
